bug.short_desc: imjournal stops logging due to corrupt state file

long_desc.thetext:
I'm seeing this in /var/log/messages:
Jun 19 14:30:51 gryphon rsyslogd-2027: imjournal: fscanf on state file `/var/lib/rsyslog/imjournal.state' failed [v8.8.0 try http://www.rsyslog.com/e/2027 ]
...and seem to be getting no other logging. IMO the system should be more robust against the file being corrupt or (as in my case) empty.
(See also not-entirely-related bug #1088021.)
I've been having problems with the machine (can't log in, likes to stop responding) that have been causing me to do hard power cycles quite often. It may be that this is what causes the corruption.
(Note: From second/third-hand accounts, this may be fixed already upstream and just needs a new package built and/or is waiting on a new upstream release.)

Fedora 22 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2016-07-19. Fedora 22 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug.
If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug.
Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.

fixed by new version in rawhide, corrupting/deleting /var/lib/rsyslog/imjournal.state does no longer produce any errors in /var/log/messages
closing
